definition: changeable/changing/varied/full of changes
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
variant of 花[hua1]
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
end/extremity/item/port/to hold sth level with both hands/to carry/regular

sentences.english: He has got used to her varying moods.
sentences.chinese: 他已經習慣了她變化多端的情緒了。

sentences.english: He's always changing his way of serving.
All texts are localizable or changeable.
sentences.chinese: 各文本定位或變化多端。

sentences.english: When practicing, you need to stick the spear to the body, with neat movement, and entire strength, many changes.
sentences.chinese: 要求練時槍不離身，動作整齊，勁整簡潔，變化多端。

sentences.english: East road "Er-ren-tai" melodies persuasive smooth, the melody is changeable.
sentences.chinese: 東路二人臺的唱腔則婉轉流暢，旋律變化多端。

sentences.english: In the face of the changing modus operandi, notaries are also quite helpless.
sentences.chinese: 面對犯罪手法的變化多端，公證人員們也頗爲無奈。

sentences.english: They are durable, fit well, and are versatile because they have so many colors.
sentences.chinese: 鞋子很耐磨，合腳，變化多端，那麼多色彩。

sentences.english: I love the nature, and get so obsessed with the diversed physical phenomena.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡大自然，更好奇大自然中變化多端的物理現象。

sentences.english: The content of bizarre hallucinations and changeable.
sentences.chinese: 幻覺內容離奇古怪，變化多端。

definition: countless changes/constant permutation
to blend into one another/to blend together well
to change unpredictably/unpredictable/erratic/treacherous
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
fickle/multi-variate (math.)
intricate/complicated/tangled/involved/to synthesize
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
(idiom) impossible to fault/impeccable
exquisite
singularly beautiful/weird and wonderful
to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
shade (of a color, i.e. light or dark)
lit. seamless heavenly clothes (idiom)/fig. flawless
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
all-embracing/all-inclusive
bright and beautiful/(of a landscape) gorgeous/(of a color) vibrant
